poem:
Title: "To the Breath We Share"

Beneath the city's sky so grey,
Legacy echoes in the air today,
Reminding hearts that in their chests,
Lies the truth of Six Cities' quest.
From London's dawn to twilight's hue,
A whisper of change certainly grew,
Invisible chains of breath we haul,
A dance of life within us all. 
Our dreams, unmarred by pollution's plea,
Seek a tomorrow, clean and free.
